intro: Hieracium inflatum, commonly known as the inflated hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated flower heads that resemble small, rounded balls. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branching. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
